items.prompt: Complete: 'She ______ the phone at the front desk.'

items.explanation: Human Resources (HR) is 'Recursos Humanos' in Spanish.

items.prompt: Choose the correct verb: 'My colleague ______ reports every Friday.'
items.explanation: My colleague (he or she) takes the '-s' form: 'writes'.

items.prompt: Which professional is responsible for legal matters?
items.explanation: A lawyer provides legal advice and representation.

items.prompt: Complete: 'You ______ very fast on the keyboard.'
items.explanation: With 'You', we use the base form of the verb: 'type'.

items.prompt: What is a 'Sales Representative'?
items.explanation: A sales representative is someone who sells products or services for a company.

items.prompt: Complete: 'The sun ______ in the east.'
items.explanation: The sun (it) takes the '-s' form: 'rises'.

items.prompt: A person who fixes cars is a ______.
items.explanation: A mechanic is someone who repairs and maintains machinery and motors.

items.prompt: Complete: 'My boss ______ the meeting at 10:00.'
items.explanation: My boss (he/she) takes the third-person singular '-s': 'starts'.

items.prompt: What is 'Engineer' in Spanish?
items.explanation: An engineer is an 'ingeniero' in Spanish.

items.prompt: Complete: 'Sarah ______ lunch at her desk.'
items.explanation: Sarah (she) requires the '-s' form: 'eats'.

items.prompt: Which department handles money and payments?
items.explanation: The Finance department manages the company's money.

items.prompt: Complete: 'We ______ to the office by bus.'
items.explanation: With 'We', we use the base form 'go'.

items.prompt: A 'Graphic Designer' creates ______.
items.explanation: Graphic designers create visual concepts to communicate ideas.

items.prompt: Complete: 'The company ______ new laptops every year.'
items.explanation: The company (it) takes the '-s' form: 'buys'.

items.prompt: What is 'Secretary' in Spanish?
items.explanation: Secretary is 'secretario' or 'secretaria' in Spanish.

items.prompt: Complete: 'You ______ the project requirements.'
items.explanation: With 'You', we use the base form 'understand'.

items.prompt: Which job title is usually higher?
items.explanation: A Director is a high-level executive role.

items.explanation: My father (he) takes the '-s' form: 'works'.

items.text: I [work] as an accountant in a small firm.
items.explanation: The base form 'work' is used with 'I'.

items.text: The receptionist [greets] the visitors at the entrance.
items.explanation: The receptionist (he/she) requires the '-s' form 'greets'.

items.text: They [speak] English and French in the office.
items.explanation: With 'They', we use the base form 'speak'.

items.text: A manager [supervises] the team members.
items.explanation: A manager (singular) needs the '-s' ending on the verb.

items.text: You [have] a meeting with the CEO today.
items.explanation: With 'You', we use 'have' instead of 'has'.

items.text: She [finishes] work at 5:00 PM.
items.explanation: Verbs ending in -sh add '-es' for the third person singular.

items.text: We [organize] the files every Friday.
items.explanation: With 'We', we use the base form 'organize'.

items.text: He [uses] a laptop for his presentations.
items.explanation: He (singular) requires the '-s' form 'uses'.

items.text: My assistant [types] all the letters.
items.explanation: My assistant (he/she) needs the '-s' ending.

items.text: The company [provides] health insurance for all employees.
items.explanation: The company (it) takes the '-s' form 'provides'.

items.text: I [drink] tea during my break.
items.explanation: With 'I', we use the base form 'drink'.

items.text: Sarah [studies] business administration at night.
items.explanation: For verbs ending in consonant + y, change 'y' to 'i' and add '-es' for he/she/it.

items.text: They [travel] to London for business once a month.
items.explanation: With 'They', use the base form 'travel'.

items.text: The developer [fixes] the bugs in the system.
items.explanation: Verbs ending in -x add '-es' for the third person singular.

items.text: You [read] the company manual on your first day.
items.explanation: With 'You', use the base form 'read'.

items.text: Mark is an accountant. He works from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM. Every morning, he checks his emails and drinks a cup of coffee. Then, he prepares financial reports for the manager. At 1:00 PM, he eats lunch with his colleagues. In the afternoon, he organizes invoices and files documents.
